data.title: Graphical trash on the next lines using outlines at say_dialogue
data.body:
Watch gif example
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24704640/22206026/1e204440-e182-11e6-8a4f-4a29ff83681f.gif)
graphical trash appears only from this outlines code
```
init -1 style say_dialogue:
    xpos 220
    xanchor gui.text_xalign
    xsize 840
    line_spacing 3
    ypos gui.text_ypos
    justify True
    text_align gui.text_xalign
    layout ("subtitle" if gui.text_xalign else "tex")
    outlines [(2, gui.text_outline_color, 0, 1),(1.5, gui.text_outline_color, 0, 0)]
```

data.title: Bug or not?
data.body:
Under this setup, the second text displayable gets stuck on Cat when the script makes it to Cow. I am not 100% sure if it's a bug or expected behavior as it does not occur with window set on "auto"... as usual original code is very long but it all comes down to this:

```renpy
# options.rpy
define config.window = "hide"

# screens.rpy
screen say(who, what):
    style_prefix "say"

    if who is not None:
        vbox:
            text who
            fixed:
                at Transform(yzoom=.6)
                text who at Transform(alpha=.6) # Second text displayable
                
    # ... rest of the normal say screen...
    
# script.rpy
label start:
    "Cat" "Meow!"
    "Cow" "Mooo!"

data.title: replace_text only functions if a custom_text_tag has been defined
data.body:
In text/text.py, `renpy.config.replace_text` is only applied within a function that's only called `if renpy.config.custom_text_tags`. Therefore, if you haven't set any custom text tags at all, the empty dict evaluates False and config.replace_text has no effect.

This is probably responsible for past reports of replace_text not working, e.g. https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=38198

data.title: Issue with ALSA when trying to run Ren'Py 6.99.11 or higher on Travis CI
data.body:
Hey! I'm trying to integrate a Ren'Py project here on GItHub with Travis CI as descibed in [this](http://fuckyeahrenpy.tumblr.com/post/115884786323/automatically-testing-a-renpy-game-using-travis) tutorial. Unfortunately, when I try to build it fails with "Exception: ALSA: Couldn't open audio device: No such file or directory".

To troubleshoot, I reached out to [ExcaliburZero](https://gist.github.com/ExcaliburZero), author of the original tutorial, and he suggested I try dropping back to an older version of Ren'Py (he suggested 6.99.3). I did so, and that fixed the ALSA error, but then I got a bunch of Expression Expected lint errors.

I was able to repro these Expression Expected errors on an Ubuntu VM by running my project (available on GitHub [here](https://github.com/NumberA/ProjectGaymore)) through Lint from the 6.99.3 Ren'Py SDK. I ran Lint from command line using **./renpy.sh "../ProjectGaymore/" lint**. When I ran the same command from the 6.99.12 Ren'Py SDK it completed without errors (printing some statistics to the terminal and then closing).

The final stage of my investigation was to return to the Travis CI tests and increment the Ren'Py SDK version I was running them against until the error switched from lint errors to ALSA exceptions. That happened between 6.99.10 and 6.99.11.  My test logs are available [here](https://travis-ci.org/NumberA/ProjectGaymore/builds) if they're useful.

From what I can tell, the Travis CI test environment is 	Ubuntu 12.04 LTS Server Edition 64 bit ([source](https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/ci-environment/)). Is that an OS that we can expect Ren'Py to work in?

Please let me know if you need any more information or if there's anything I can do to help get to the bottom of this.

data.title: Not working: define config.has_autosave = False
data.body:
Simply add the line:
    `define config.has_autosave = False`
to a new game in options.rpy.
It still autosaves (the load screen shows the saves and they load).

data.title: imagebutton 'focus_mask True' doesn't work at all on Android OS
data.body:
Hello,
I noticed that `focus_mask` doesn't work at all on Android OS. Anywhere I tap on the screen, it will select the last added imagebutton, this might be because of `focus_mask` not working.
On desktop `focus_mask True` works as intended, I can select by clicking any imagebutton.

Possible related information:
In Ren'Py's documentation in Android section there is this: 

> Ren'Py can't handle transparency in buttons and imagemaps. (This is due to performance problems on some devices with the display modes needed to support deciding which pixels are transparent.)

So it might be related.


Device used for testing: OnePlus X (Snapdragon 801, Quad-core 2.3 GHz Krait 400 (ARM architecture), Adreno 330)

Is there a workaround for this issue on Android?

data.title: Setting config.quit_action to ui.gamemenus always open up the save screen
data.body:
No matter what value is provided for ui.gamemenus, it will always open the save screen

```
config.quit_action = ui.gamemenus("_quit_prompt")
config.quit_action = ui.gamemenus("_quit_prompt_dummy_name")
config.quit_action = ui.gamemenus("_main_menu_prompt")
```
all open the save screen,
(It worked perfectly in v6.99.11.1749)

data.title: MultiPersistent broken on 6.99.12
data.body:
I just reinstall RenPy to 6.99.12 from 6.99.11 and than i take only one issue with MP. Everything work on older version, but with newest version MP just seems like something not working. 
After playing with reencoding utf-8 script file and even separating code i just create new one project and paste renpy example in new file:
```
init python:
    mp = MultiPersistent("demo.renpy.org")
```
And hooray, even this not working!
```
While running game code:
  File "game/1.rpy", line 2, in <module>
    mp = MultiPersistent("demo.renpy.org")
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc0 in position 9: ordinal not in range(128)

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "lib/windows-i686/1.rpyc", line 1, in script
  File "C:\renpy-6.99.12-sdk\renpy\ast.py", line 814, in execute
    renpy.python.py_exec_bytecode(self.code.bytecode, self.hide, store=self.store)
  File "C:\renpy-6.99.12-sdk\renpy\python.py", line 1695, in py_exec_bytecode
    exec bytecode in globals, locals
  File "game/1.rpy", line 2, in <module>
    mp = MultiPersistent("demo.renpy.org")
  File "C:\renpy-6.99.12-sdk\renpy\persistent.py", line 469, in MultiPersistent
    fn = fn + "/" + name
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc0 in position 9: ordinal not in range(128)
```
And i attached test project with log, traceback and 1.rpy (just with multipersistent function) and everything else
[1.zip](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/files/667334/1.zip)

data.title: Text outlines don't scale along with text when game window is resized
data.body:
If a text style has outlines, then the thickness of the outlines doesn't increase along with everything else being scaled up. For example, my game window is 1280x720, but when I enter fullscreen, my screen size is 1920x1080. This causes outlines to look much thinner when in fullscreen.

To help demonstrate this, I'll use a more extreme example of resolution differences.

Text outline at 640x360:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7810794/21138070/acf1f678-c0e9-11e6-92b4-d7a52c8de56b.png)

The same text at 1920x1080:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7810794/21138077/b5b4e6bc-c0e9-11e6-885b-3180d0af875f.png)

Since the text was scaled up, but the outline remains the same size, the outline appears much thinner.

data.title: Request: im.matrix.brightnesscutoff(alpha,invert=False)
data.body:
This function would receive a float argument 'alpha' between 0 and 1, and make any pixel with brightness bellow that number pure white, and any pixel above that pure black.

Invert would switch the whites and blacks.

Here's a practical example of the intended behavior.
Using this as our base image
![gradient](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12227163/21081547/42d58e0e-bfc1-11e6-9e05-2dde27fcee0c.jpg)
 
If we did `im.MatrixColor("mask.png", im.matrix.brightnesscutoff(0.5))` we would get:
![cutoff05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12227163/21081510/a826b93c-bfc0-11e6-9287-67e9c395b3e6.jpg)

And `im.MatrixColor("mask.png", im.matrix.brightnesscutoff(0.8))` we'd get:
![cutoff08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12227163/21081541/ff23e5f2-bfc0-11e6-90fe-f280567b7b9a.jpg)

This, coupled with im.AlphaMask() should allow devs to do things such as curved health bars, or other progressive cutoff image elements that aren't straight, which is something I've personally been wanting for a while.
